scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Melanie
scrape.text: Every single time i see this book on a shelf or a display or recommended list or an article, i cringe. literally. whether inside or outside or both, i'm not really sure, but i was continually amazed at how bad it all seemed to be laid out; grammer, word choice, timeline (altho that is somewhat a separate topic, also), characters, character development, conversations, you name it. every 3 pages or so i had to consciously pull my mind away from the errors +frustrating points and get it back into the story. it was so unbelievably just WRONG that i had a hard time believing it was actually being published as such an unfinished feeling product. i would rate this one .5 stars, if it were possible.
